OOC: Well, then, I give it a fair chance. I reacted that way I think becaus=
e I'm still upset about the death of NBMSSO. But then again, it's death may=
 have brought for the life of DBZSF, since it made me spend more time on it=
. I'm still actually one of the only ones in the RPG who prefers to do more=
 talking than fighting, like what goes on in DBZSF. I say, whatever comes a=
round in this RPG, comes around, I don't fear the future...


  ----- Origi=
nal Message ----- 
  From: KSLawdogg@... 
  To: nbwrpg@yahoogroups.com

  Sent: Wednesday, November 21, 2001 3:29 PM
  Subject: Re: Debate (importa=
nt everyone read)


  (I beg to differ.  I'm in a MUSH, that takes place so=
lely on Cybertron.  And 
  it is way better than the NBW.  Cybertron would =
just require lots of 
  thinking.  Like the millions if not billions of civ=
ilians that would be on 
  the planet, and since all we do in this RPG is f=
ight we'd have to take that 
  into account.

  Because most factions in th=
e NBW have, if they're big, 20 characters, and 20 
  characters would mean =
jack crap compared to a population of millions or 
  billions.)
